item.title: Github Pages with Jekyll themes and Giscus
item.author: buivanyk4@gmail.com (w41bu1)
item.description: When starting a personal blog, there are three tools you should know: GitHub Pages, Jekyll, and Giscus. Github Pages: A free service from GitHub that allows you to deploy static websites directly from a repository. Just push your code to GitHub, and your blog will automatically go live on the Internet without needing your own server. Jekyll: A static site generator integrated with GitHub Pages. Jekyll makes it easy to create blogs from Markdown files, organize content using templates, and apply ready-to-use themes.
